description: Dwyane Wade scored 10 of his 28 points in the fourth quarter, and Hassan Whiteside had 20 points and 13 rebounds as Miami beat the Nets, 104-98, at Barclays Center.
title: Wade and Whiteside Lead Heat Past Nets
title_page: Wade and Whiteside Lead Heat Past Nets - The New York Times
text:
Dwyane Wade scored 10 of his 28 points in the fourth quarter, and Hassan Whiteside had 20 points and 13 rebounds as the Miami Heat beat the Nets, 104-98, on Wednesday night at Barclays Center.
Goran Dragic added 16 points for Miami, which has won three straight. The Heat have also won five in a row against the Nets and 11 of their last 13 meetings on the road.
“Dwyane had a real pep in his step,” Heat Coach Erik Spoelstra said. “This is what he’s built his career on. He had the full pie chart going.”
Brook Lopez scored 25 points, and Jarrett Jack had 22 points and 10 assists for the Nets, who lost the final three games of their six-game homestand.
